website_summaries.verdict: A top-selling kitten milk replacement that has earned a loyal customer following for the healthful formula that most  kittens can't wait to devour.
pros: Packed with nutrients and protein, and contains probiotics and preboitics for improved digestive health
Great for kittens of various ages, and also works as a supplement for aging/sick cats
Available in kitten and weaning formulas
cons: A few reports of cans that were dented upon arrival
Some cats don't like it, but most do

website_summaries.verdict: Caring for nursing kittens is already tough, but feeding hungry kittens with this simple supplement is as easy as cracking the tab and pouring a bowl of tasty milk filled with vitamins, minerals, and amino acids.
pros: Provides the balanced nutrition a kitten needs
cons: Its first ingredient is water, but the second ingredient is skim milk

customer_reviews.title: Great for putting weight on sick cat
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for our old cat when she lost too much weight due to anemia. She loved this formula and it did the trick. She's put another 2 lbs back on (up from 4 lbs) and looks cute with a milk beard. Surprisingly, she's the only cat in the house that can eat it. The other 3 vomit after drinking it.
customer_reviews.author: sillylaughter

customer_reviews.title: They love when it's time for some kitty milk
customer_reviews.text: We rescued two kitties from CL people who clearly had no idea how demanding kittens were. When we got Nairobi and Cortez they were tiny and malnourished...they'd been pulled from their mother far too early. Luckily KMR proved to be exactly what they needed! Both kitties are now thriving and more mischievous than you could ever imagine! They love when it's time for some kitty milk!
customer_reviews.author: Hayls

customer_reviews.title: This was a life saver, literally!!
customer_reviews.text: We rescued an abandoned kitten. When she was found, her belly was concave and her ribs protruding. It was heart breaking but we were determined to nurse her back to health. We got her this milk and gave it to her on its own and then began mixing it into her kitten food so she was getting the necessary nutrients that she had lacked before. She slowly put on weight and has been great ever since!!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Talk to the paw!
customer_reviews.text: I've raised two abandoned kittens on this. It works well, they both seemed to like it. Now if I can just get my friends to stop giving me tiny kittens! (I may or may not be joking here.) I mixed this using a protein shake bottle with a whisk ball. I didn't have any clumping issues, using that method, for whatever that is worth. Immersion blender is easy, too.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Duffield

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I started feeding my senior cat canned kitten milk as a supplement to her diet. No matter how much she ate, she was always hungry and never gained weight. The kitten milk satisfied her, but it was really expensive so I bought this powdered product. When mixed and refrigerated, it had the same creamy consistency of the canned version. (I would warm it in the microwave before feeding.) I highly recommend this, not just for kittens but for cats who are elderly or ill. It provides the nutrients they need and is very digestible.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Sue

customer_reviews.title: Stick to the canned- if you expect your kittens to survive.
customer_reviews.text: This powdered version caused terrible constipation in two separate litters of foster kittens. So much so one of my babies just stopped eating & had to be syringe fed. After several DIED I went to the vet & discovered it was from the powdered formula not digesting. Switched to the canned & the constipation cleared right up. It also caused a disturbing level of congestion in their throats after they would eat it. Not so with the canned. The canned premix is expensive. But a lot cheaper than vet visits & the heartache of sick & dying kittens. Stick with that.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Brown

customer_reviews.title: Good, strong kitties!!
customer_reviews.text: My baby Bermy was abandoned by her mom in some briars below my house. I’d raised a kitten by hand before, but it was a bit older so I was nervous. She took to it right off the bat, loved feeding time. She’s now six months old and super healthy, and I only needed one can for her!! Recommend, it definitely saved her.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Saving lives, but follow the directions.
customer_reviews.text: This product is great! I keep it in the refrigerator so that it stays fresh. I have discovered that if the kitten is only surviving on this formula and no mother’s milk at all, it is important to dilute the powder a little bit than to have too much powder. Directions say use two parts warm water for one part powder. It’s important to level off the powder when measuring because the kitten will become terribly constipated if the formula is too rich. If this formula is all the kitten is eating, it is important to also include a kitten probiotic in their diet. I’d also recommend using the Miracle Nipple to feed.
customer_reviews.author: Mandee

customer_reviews.title: My kitten loves it
customer_reviews.text: My 11 week old kitten loves this formula. She’ll be sleeping when I put a small serving by her and she’ll perk up and start drinking it right away. I give her one scoop serving just about every day along with her soft and solid food just to make sure she gets proper nutrition to grow healthy and strong. I was going to purchase this from Petsmart but they were selling a soda-like can for $8 that had to be used or disposed of right away. Glad I got this. Must buy for your kitties! I’m not surprised she likes this either because it smells sweet and creamy. Has the consistency like a cake batter when mixed with water.
customer_reviews.author: Elena R.

customer_reviews.title: MAKE-IT-YOURSELF!
customer_reviews.text: Love this powder for it's ease-of-use. Difficult to locate now, so I've switched to the liquid KMR. Truth is, kittens seem to prefer the powder taste to the liquid. I've not tried it (and won't), but that's the consensus here...Recommended--just watch out for price-gougers here. Such a shame folks can be of that ilk...KMR products have brought our preemies through to nearly 90 days old...
customer_reviews.author: Shopping Maven

customer_reviews.title: Saves lives
customer_reviews.text: Geraldine was screaming hungry and dehydrated when we started on kmr at 2 weeks. Here she is at 5 weeks a healthy plump baby.
customer_reviews.author: lhsouthern1988

customer_reviews.title: as described / advertised
customer_reviews.text: we found that between this and  Nutri-Vet they are both great products that do as advertised so we buy which ever is cheaper at the time that we need it. we foster kittens for our local animal shelter / humane society and have found (unscientifically) through observation that both work and the kittens do not seem to have a preference. so i can and would recommend both / either if you find yourself in need of a mothers milk replacement.
customer_reviews.author: joe doughnut

customer_reviews.title: saved 4 kittens
customer_reviews.text: a feral cat had kittens in our workshop and abandoned them! We had to hand raise 4 kittens for weeks using this KMR and it was a multi-life-saver!! All the kittens grew up to be super healthy - 2 found homes in beautiful families and we kept 2. Thank you KMR! Amazon has good prices compared to other places ... crazy how expensive something like this is ...and saving a kitten is a good deed and time consuming ...
customer_reviews.author: rural girl

customer_reviews.title: We use this brand for wildlife rehabilitation and has worked amazing for their sensitive digestive tracts
customer_reviews.text: KMR formula is the easiest formula to mix when compared to the other off brands. Less clumping, quicker to mix without frustration. We use this brand for wildlife rehabilitation and has worked amazing for their sensitive digestive tracts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Go-To Kitten Milk
customer_reviews.text: We've fostered 120 kittens over the years. KMR is so far the best kitten milk we've been able to find, and have a reasonable cost to product ratio. When we bought this product the price was just over $12 for the 12oz size. It's powdered so you do have to make it up (1:2 ratio). It's a good consistence and the kittens have no gut issues with this product. We do add a little probiotic on a weekly basis and these two products mix together well. Unless we can locate a better product, this is will always be our 'go-to' for orphaned kittens.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I've got (3) 10 month old kittens that have some preliminary health issues because the did not have kitten milk when they were young. W needed to get their immune system up. I've tried both the canned and powdered form. My cats love the powdered, but not the canned. They don't get sick on this, as they did with goats milk. It's easy to mix and has no lumps. I'd recommend making a slurry/paste & adding the water a little at a time, until you get the right ratio / consistency. Highly recommended for kittens or cats of any age that need a little more nutrition.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WON'T drink it
customer_reviews.text: The newborn kittens have zero interest in drinking this. I ordered this ahead of birth (this was a neighborhood cat so this came up suddenly). A friend who is a vet suggested what to get in advance. I thought this was covered. Now I am scrambling (on a Sunday) to get supplemental food in 6 kittens. Also. feeding bottles may come with no holes in the nipples. It is impossible to get holes that allow sucking. And squirting milk replace in a kittens mouth can go down the windpipe, cause pneumonia, and kill the kitten. Somebody needs to figure out a REAL solution.
customer_reviews.author: dave the vegan

customer_reviews.title: Supposed to be kept in cool dark spaces
customer_reviews.text: This product is supposed to be kept in a cool darker place when storing it, but when I received it, it was super warm to the touch opening the package. I received the box as soon as the delivery guy dropped it off and took it inside so that it wouldn't sit on my porch in the sun and be ruined. The box was all beaten up, and so was the can of formula inside of it. Literally powder was everywhere. Not impressed, and won't be purchasing this formula online again. I ended up being able to find some in stock at Tractor Supply and went and bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Excellence as your cat's early morning "coffee"
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I buy it for our 2 adult feline companion. Why ? When I get up in the morning they want something to eat but at 5 AM, can food could result in vomit. Too early for that. I now give them some KMR just like I have my coffee and this holds them fine for a while. No more vomit over solid food too early. Those who don't know cats will think "why just not wait to feed them until later ? " That tells me they don't have cats and don't know how a hungry cat will work you.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E. Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product helps all baby animals
customer_reviews.text: When my dog told me to purchase this over any other thing I did I had six opossum babies that were for a rescue and release and I had a raccoon baby that I needed to feed my own pet. Not only were all the animals extremely healthy easy to feed with this there a little bit on the thick side when opossums left. My Raccon just gave up her bottle 2 weeks ago. If you want a product that has lots of good things to help keep your baby's alive I would suggest using this with my animals however I did add probiotics and something called Wild trax
customer_reviews.author: Meadow Thorne

customer_reviews.title: Saved My Kitten’s Life
customer_reviews.text: We took in a pregnant kitty, and she gave birth to four kittens. Even though they were all eating and whatnot, one was just not gaining enough weight. She had pale gums, was ultra thin, and was overall, not in good shape. We bought this KMR, and after a week, she had gained a pound, was no longer sickly looking, and had even more energy. This only con I would say is this stuff is extremely difficult to completely break up if you don’t have a bottle to shake it in. If you’re just stirring it up in a bowl, it will still have some clumps.
customer_reviews.author: Hailey

customer_reviews.title: KMR, exactly what baby kittens need!
customer_reviews.text: I foster orphaned kittens too young to be weaned. This is what I use with bottled water only. I also dilute it 1:3 instead of 1:2, sometimes I keep the 1:2. I added pictures of all 8 of my bottle fed kittens that survived thanks to KMR. One of the Siamese mix, we kept, but the rest were all adopted to loving homes. Can't wait to foster more in the new year!
customer_reviews.author: Homeschool_Momma_of_Three

customer_reviews.title: It Helped
customer_reviews.text: Got this milk substitute for a new mommy feral cat who was not eating, was extremely thin, and had four baby kittens. The mom had gotten used to us and immediately drank this liquid when we put it out for her. Two months later she is still alive, and the kittens are growing up. I believe this helped get her over a hurdle, particularly because she started eating better after trying this out. For the first few times I put a half teaspoon of chopped-up canned food in the middle of the milk and I think that helped draw her to the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Aunt Nancy

customer_reviews.title: LUMPS!!!
customer_reviews.text: It is impossible to mix without lumps - hot water, whisk, shaking, praying... you name it, you will have lumps! This is horrible because it won't come thought the nipple.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Sofia

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is my preferred brand for fostering kittens. I have also fostered rabbits with this as well but for that I prefer the liquid cans because rabbits get constipated extremely easily. I find that adding probiotics is a good idea to keep little kitten tummies running smoothly. This product is a bit difficult to mix if you don't get the water warm enough and will clog bottle nipples. All in all no complaints. And if you can get this as an add on it's much cheaper than buying the 6oz size from your local pet store/ tractor supply.
customer_reviews.author: MW88Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Your Basic Essential
customer_reviews.text: We've purchased this for bottle baby foster kittens time and time again, as our county shelter only wants us to use this brand. Unfortunately, all KMR has a tendency to "bung up" a kitten, and this powder is no exception. It also hardens like cement on a kittens face (and paws, and tail, and bare skin) so be sure to wash thoroughly when they are going through their dredging phase. All that being said, it has kept our little ones alive and putting on weight. I even add it to canned food for weaned but underweight kittens, and it helps them to pack on the ounces. :)
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas & Cheyenne

customer_reviews.title: I don't recommend this one
customer_reviews.text: I've been using KMR FOREVER, but the kittens always end up having diarrea. This recipe has skim milk in it, so maybe that's the cause of the diarrea. My cat found a day old baby outside and before I fed her this, her poops were normal, brown and soft/solid. After this, she never pooped the same nor would she grow how she needed. I switched to Breeders Edge and the diarrea stopped! Never going back again, invest in your little ones!
customer_reviews.author: Susana Soto

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver for my senior cat
customer_reviews.text: This has been a lifesaver for my senior cat with hyperthyroid. She was skin and bones at 6.8 pounds and always seemed to be starving. In addition to medication she gets this after breakfast and after dinner and loves it. She gained 1/2 pound in 4 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for sick/old cats
customer_reviews.text: Good product, as advertised. I bought it when an older cat of mine became sick. Because of a tumor in her mouth she was in a great deal of pain and had trouble eating solid food, but also refused to eat wet food. I was able to feed her this for awhile through a pipette. Though she ultimately passed I believe switching to this helped her stay for a few more weeks because she was still able to get nutrition.
customer_reviews.author: M. Santos

customer_reviews.title: KMR Helped Save Orphaned Kitten
customer_reviews.text: I have been caring for a newborn kitten that was literally dumped from a car and left by the road at a few days old or less. I'll never know how anyone can do that or why. This little kitten is now 7 weeks old and has done so well with this formula. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for orphaned kittens
customer_reviews.text: I rescued two kittens that were only twelve days old and abandoned by their mother. I had no idea what to do. I found a blogger that teaches you how to care for orphaned kittens and she recommended this milk. It really saved the kittens and helped them survive even though my vet wasn’t sure they’d make it. The kittens loved this milk and couldn’t wait for their feedings. They have grown into two healthy kitties and are doing so well at four months old now!
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Got two kittens through their hard time
customer_reviews.text: I found two abandoned kittens in my company’s parking lot and decided to adopt them. They were so young that they had problem with my home made cat food even after I run it through a food processor to completely liquify it. So I switched to KMR and slowing switch to their normal food by mixing in with KMR over the course of a month. The kittens loves the KMR and are growing up very healthy and full of energy.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Works if you need to feed a baby critter.
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't be able to tell you what the flavor was like seeing as it's not something for human consumption. What I can tell u is that I used it to feed a baby rabbit and by itself my rabbit wouldn't eat it. Once I mixed it with goats milk instead of water my rabbit couldn't get enough of it. Now that baby rabbit that didn't even have his eyes open is full grown almost as year old and full of play bounce n life .
customer_reviews.author: LoisIris

customer_reviews.title: Kitten savior
customer_reviews.text: My friend found this little guy on the garbage with his eyes still closed. She was about to give up because she's a rescuer and lost many newborn kittens. I gave her the milk. This is the "after" photos. He never rejected the milk. I am so happy.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Causing runs?????
customer_reviews.text: I am not big on writing Reviews but felt this could help someone. At first, this formula was causing week old kitten to diarrhea bad. So... I switched formula to find that did not help much either. It was not till I got a cat probiotic to put into the formula that digestion became easier and started to clear it up. Cat is back on it and love the taste. Not causing runs anymore although kmr should put it into the formula to help kitties digestion.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Lucido

customer_reviews.title: Great for an adult cat who stops eating cat food
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my eight year old cat who wasn't eating much and was losing weight. A FULL veterinary work-up with blood and urine tests and GI X-rays showed nothing. He was treated with anti-inflammatory and an antibiotic in case there was some hidden infection. He would eat a bite or two of food and then walk away. I mixed up some of this and put a little out whenever I fed him. He laps it up eagerly. He has regained the lost weight, has a shinier coat and will now eats his cat food. I'm so glad I found this.
customer_reviews.author: GeeBLateTop Contributor: Nail Art

customer_reviews.title: Great for kittens
customer_reviews.text: I got this milk for the kittens at my local shelter, during "kitten season" which is when many cats give birth and need much care and this milk is the closet that we can get to heir cat mama's milk, it is cheaper to buy small cans than getting the big one, please check on that. Besides that if you do not need it for your own kitten , this will make a great gift for any cat shelter. Please fix all animals and rescue from shelter . I uploaded a photo of one of my rescued cats, he is very Happy now, and fixed! 😻
customer_reviews.author: MediaBoxEnt

customer_reviews.title: kitten milk replacer
customer_reviews.text: I adopted a 2 week old kitten. one of a pair that had been found by a kind person who brought them to a friend who cares for cats. I took the weak little runt with very few hopes that she would live, but she did well with some vet care and KMR, first syringe fed, then bottle fed until she was 6 weeks old. She's thriving and will be a happy cat. I've named her Xena, Warrior Kitten.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Frazier

customer_reviews.title: Looks better than local big box store alts
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be thicker and as a non-kitten looks better. My suggestion on the instructions is give a few different measurements between Tablespoons versus Ounces. Additionally HIGHLY suggest that using Filtered or Distilled water to prevent constipation and to that end would go ever so slightly lean on the mix if they are newborn. It suggest 2 tablespoons of water to 1 tablespoon of mix just go slightly lean?
customer_reviews.author: Murad A Watson

customer_reviews.title: Great Savings and kittens love it
customer_reviews.text: I foster cats and kittens for the local humane society. I try to keep a can of KMR on hand since I don’t know when a new litter will come in that might need extra feedings for weight gain and health. I mix the KMR as directed and add pate’ cat food to make a thick gruel. The cats and kittens love it! I had been paying twice as much for KMR at a local pet store until I found this on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: SueMax60

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Formula!!
customer_reviews.text: No wonder Kitten Lady recommends this!! My very sick 4 week old foster kittens were refusing to eat the other formula I had bought for them and had diarrhea from it when I finally was able to manage it down their throats. I switched them to KMR and they’re now THRIVING. My runt has doubled her weight since switching to this formula and the others are now within normal weights for their size and their diarrhea is GONE!! This formula is awesome and will be the only one I use for foster kittens in the future
customer_reviews.author: Aurora Ruloph

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: This does not dissolve in water to an acceptable degree and will clod the nipple. I’ve tried everything to get it to dissolve - hot water, whisking, shaking, sifting the dry powder before mixing, blending, everything. It does seem better after it sits a day, but you’re not supposed to keep it past 24 hours. I have use the canned formula which was fine, and other powdered brands which also were fine. This is not fine.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Vorwerk

customer_reviews.title: KMR Kitten Milk-Great Replacement
customer_reviews.text: Great Milk replacement for Kittens or older cats. This was sent to a local shelter for foster kittens. I've used KMR for several years for Kittens and old cats with no problems or issues. It does clump sometimes when mix, but cats love it. Also another alternative would be goats milk.
customer_reviews.author: schnauzerculler

customer_reviews.title: Jackson loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My 8mo kitten Jackson loves this! I wanted to supplement his existing diet ( moist & dry) to boost his immune system. He loves the milk. I mix WARM tap water w/powdered mix. Note: ONE part powdered mix with TWO part WARM water. I emphasis warm water because it helps to break down the powder. I use a spoon to mix.( Instructions on container state do not virgouersly mix.) So far Jackson loves the milk and there has been no change in his stools; i.e. Firm not runny. I keep the open container refrigerated. Any leftover milk is immediately discarded.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t get what I paid for!
customer_reviews.text: Beware with purchasing this. When I opened this kitten formula the entire can of powder mixture was clumped together as if it was exposed to moisture. Also the mixture itself was an entirely different color and texture than what it should have been. Very aggravating since I needed it asap for a bottle feeding kitten I rescued. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: bookwormamy

customer_reviews.title: For senior cats too
customer_reviews.text: Used this for my senior cat when he was having issues losing weight and no appetite. He ate this readily and really enjoyed it. Used this and other kitten milk brands and it helped him regain some weight and appetite. Adult formulas do not have as many calories and fat.
customer_reviews.author: pattysue

customer_reviews.title: My six month old kitten refuses to eat regular cat ...
customer_reviews.text: My six month old kitten refuses to eat regular cat food so I've been looking to supplement her diet to ensure she's getting proper nutrition. I bought this powder mix along with the canned milk and although she refused to drink the milk from the can, she did drink up some this stuff, which was a relief. Let me just state for the record, this cat takes the cake on pickiness. Won't eat fresh fish, tuna from a can or even sardines. She'll only eat chicken and maybe turkey.. And I've had to add a vitamin powder and taurine to her food because she just turns her nose up on EVERYTHING.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Great for kittens and older kitties too!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a recommendation from the lady I bought my fur baby from. He was 7-8 weeks old at the time. My growing kitty LOVES this stuff! He is now about 9 months old so I don’t give it to him as regularly as I once did, but he does get it as a special treat once a week or so. I also had an older cat who recently passed away, but before that happened I gave this to her because she was having trouble eating her regular food. This milk was heaven for her.
customer_reviews.author: Arielle

customer_reviews.title: Life saver!!!!!😀.
customer_reviews.text: This is my daughter writing, This stuff is really awesome!!!! Saved the life of a barely living kitten!😖. The kitten was only barely a week old when we found it, and is now thriving at a month old!!!!!🤗. Our kitten LOVES this milk replacement!!!!!! 😍❤️. Tip- You need to keep powder, AND bottle of milk replacement, CONSTANTLY refrigerated. If this was helpful please select “helpful
customer_reviews.author: clayton wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Great for my bottle babes!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazon to the rescue. I had two little bottle babe kittens who used like 6 cans of this stuff. It was great, easy to mix, and vet-recommended! My little kittens are now doing great and eating kitten food! Weren't too sure they would make it in the start but they sure fattened right up with lots of love, snuggles, and bottles!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie B.

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work, don't buy it. watch out
customer_reviews.text: I put these stars because nobody ever sees bad reviews. DO NOT buy this milk. It causes constipation and a blockage in the throat of baby kittens. two of my 4-week-old rescued cats had to be hospitalized because of this milk. don't buy it. I do not recommend it. almost killed my kittens. Quieres a tus gatitos? No compres esta porqueria de leche que casi mata a mis gatos bebés.
customer_reviews.author: Sthepanie C

customer_reviews.title: Best Milk replacement ever!!
customer_reviews.text: KMR is the best milk replacement that I have ever used by far. It is as close to a mothers milk your ever gonna get . I have a habit of taking in all kinds of animals and KMR is my go to!! It is easy on the tummies therefore it doesn't cause problems coming back out. I have never had an animal refuse to take it and it has saved many of them in our household. I would recommend spending a couple extra bucks to get KMR, the benefits are outstanding!
customer_reviews.author: tmj

customer_reviews.title: Kittens love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a lifesaver for weaning my 5 kittens! 😻 They love the taste and within a few days, all the kittens were substantially heavier! Mom's milk is of course #1 but this product comes in close 2nd place. The product is a bit tough to blend properly but so worth the hassle! I will definitely buy more and highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Jessi

customer_reviews.title: Must have for newborn kittens.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff rocks. We had three 2 day old kittens kind of shoved on us from a neighbor who received them from a friend of a friend who was going to throw them out in to the woods to starve. We've been feeding them this kitten replacement formula since we've gotten them and they're fat and sassy. They're now 11 days old and have gained 5 oz each. Just a tip if you're feeding very young kittens: after feeding them this awesome formula, pet them for about 20 minutes after they're done eating. It stimulates circulation and digestion and they purr like the dickens.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Kitten Loves It!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband rescued a helpless kitten abandoned by her mother, she took the other kittens and left this one behind. He brought her home and she was so tiny I was afraid she would die. Fed her the KMR with an eye dropper and she loved it! She is doing great now, three weeks later, putting on plenty of weight and running around the house climbing everything. This product was literally a life saver for our new little kitten.
customer_reviews.author: KatieJo

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is truly life-sustaining for cats and kittens!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had to open our latest canister of KMR, but from lots of prior experience, I know this stuff works! We've fed this to pregnant female cats, nursing mothers, kittens who needed milk supplementation, orphaned kittens, and sick/weak adult cats- and all improved. This is the only brand I want to buy - it has far less corn syrup, maltodextrin, oils, and other ingredients that really have no place in cat food. If you compare the ingredients of KMR to another brand at the store, you quickly see the difference.
customer_reviews.author: C. Demetro

customer_reviews.title: This was an ok interim product until we found Foster ...
customer_reviews.text: This was an ok interim product until we found Foster Care. KMR is ok. Kittens are it. But they never seemed sated. They would have oddly irregular stools. One would have loose stools, the other would be stopped up. Product itself is lumpy, so it's very difficult to get a lump-free bottle of formula. Really should not have to strain it before feeding. Only used it for a week.
customer_reviews.author: shredbetty

customer_reviews.title: reliable
customer_reviews.text: This is always vet recommended, have had to re-order 4 times recently, every time it's perfect. Have been bottle feeding a kitten since he was 2 days old and so we went through quite a bit! Honestly, probably the only brand Kitten Milk I would purchase and I've bottle-fed kittens quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.  Will buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, easy to use supplement for our lactating mama cat. Adding some of the reconstituted milk to canned food has also helped with weaning the kittens. The mama and kittens LOVE this. If you try adding water to the powder, it is more difficult to mix. Instead, put warm water in a jar or other container with a lid -- and THEN add the powder. Cover and shake vigorously until the powder dissolves. Works like a charm. This is also a great supplement for cats who need extra nutrition
customer_reviews.author: KATHRYN T.

customer_reviews.title: Buy miracle nipples with this
customer_reviews.text: Bought this before and it had a sealable lid. The next time it came with no top to seal once open. Had to use my container at home to store. Kitten loves it. The flavor no clue thickness I guess ok? The value was excellent. But priced changed by $7. Went with different brand now.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Anglin

customer_reviews.title: standard food for young kittens
customer_reviews.text: We found a kitten who was pretty young and fairly sick and were able to nurse him to health using KMR. This seems to be the standard for feeding orphaned kittens and after doing much research we bought it and our little kitten loved it. Those days are long gone however and our kitten has turned into a pretty big cat now.
customer_reviews.author: H. Rast

customer_reviews.title: Helped save a life
customer_reviews.text: I didn't get to use it for my kitten, because kitty came to me with a cold and we couldn't do anything to help her... but, I got an 8 week old pittie and afterwards found out he had been poisoned by a neighbor. With the help of this kitten milk, I was able to keep something in his little tummy and keep him from dying. It was a pain in the tush to get him to regularly drink it but the vet suggested I continue giving this to him mixed with puppy mush every hour or so. (We also had to give him an IV to keep hydrated and anti-nausea pills)
customer_reviews.author: Sadi_Clan

customer_reviews.title: Gave this to stray cat of 5/6 weeks...
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to a stray kitten I found, it helped him grow and look healthier :) He was having diarrhea almost every night- my suspicion was either worms or new environment and food? Instead of mixing this product with water- I replaced it with pedialyte so he wouldn’t lose nutrients since he was still young. Worked like a charm :)
customer_reviews.author: Jess Gamez

customer_reviews.title: My cat tried it on her own. She loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought the KMR to help wean my kittens. I prepared a batch and left it out. The kittens weren't quite ready to detach from mother's milk yet. I thought it was going to waste. But a few hours later I noticed the milk levels decreasing. To my surprise, the mother was drinking. Every time I go to the kitchen, the mother is excited. She follows me and vocalizes her excitement. I'll try again with the kittens soon. For now, I am pleased that the mother has a taste for it especially since she is burning a lot of calories.
customer_reviews.author: Sarita

customer_reviews.title: It saved our kittens
customer_reviews.text: We were given some 3 week old kittens by our local Police Department because they had been captured from a dangerous situation. I rescue animals, and this is the best formula I've found. Our kittens grew up strong, and are all 8 months old now, in their new homes!
customer_reviews.author: Nunya

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Formula for baby kittens
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful product. We found 5 abandoned baby kittens. We rushed them to the vet and had them all checked out. They were healthy, but hungry. Our Vet recommended KMR, so we bottle feed until they were 7 weeks and still at 12 weeks old now they are having KMR along with their canned and dry food. They are all beautiful, with soft shinny coats. Two have new homes and we ended up keeping three of course!! :-) They are the most loving kittens. Thanks KMR for your products.
customer_reviews.author: Someone

customer_reviews.title: Great for kittens
customer_reviews.text: I had a two week old Foster kitten to bottle feed. I used both pre-mixed KMR and the powder. I found the powder to be much more convenient and user friendly. I could make only what I needed and used warm water to mix it. With the pre-mixed cans I would have to take them out of the refrigerator and heat them each time, but not too hot. The powder was much more efficient and clean. The kitten loved it and she is now happy, healthy, and living with her new family.
customer_reviews.author: CalicoSelina

customer_reviews.title: My preferred kitten milk replacement formula
customer_reviews.text: With its higher protein and fat content, I prefer using PetAg's KMR with my foster kittens spanning from days to weeks old. I can't think of any downside to using this product. Once the can is open, it should be used within three months but chances are, if yo're feeding a younger kitten/kittens, you're going to blow through the container before you reach it's expiration. Just to be safe, I write the date the container is open on the lid with a marker.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: Animal Shelters Need This - Please donate!
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving it 5 stars because I'm a board member at a local animal shelter and they always need this, especially during kitten season. Given this is the brand most often asked for by many shelters, I assume it's pretty good. Add one to your cart and donate it to a shelter! I think I bought 3 this year!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Barnett

customer_reviews.title: KMR Brand is the Best!
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite KMR product. It is the easiest to make and tends to be the brand that kittens at the shelter keep down the easiest. I do not see loose stools, vomiting, or diarrhea with this product as I see with some other brands. I am a huge fan of using KMR for kittens and giving them the proper nutrition until they are weaned.
customer_reviews.author: SiamicTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Next best thing to Cat mum’s milk
customer_reviews.text: Found a 8 week old kitten very skinny malnourished w/o her mum cat, we adopted her and found this formula very helpful. Took her to Vet first he had Rx’d antibiotics and vaccinated +exam./misc she went from 1-1/2 Lb to 2-1/2 lb In no time 😻
customer_reviews.author: Zeny Mohsenine

customer_reviews.title: Great kitten supplement.
customer_reviews.text: I ended up using this as a supplement for a litter of kittens. When it was time to transition them to solid foods I would mix this in with canned kitten food.(with a bit of water of course) I also mixed some of it with the usual canned food I gave the momma cat the first few days after the birthing. She loved it and probably ate more because of it.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: ... keep this on hand just in case has been great. We supplemented a kitten’s diet and also an ...
customer_reviews.text: Being able to keep this on hand just in case has been great. We supplemented a kitten’s diet and also an ailing cat who needed extra calories when she was suffering from uncontrollable diabetes. Easy to mix and being a powder vs prepared in a can means we can control when and how it’s used.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea C.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: My five rescued kittens( mom was attacked by coyotes) love the bottles feeding with this formula. They have rapidly gained weight and purr when they are fed. The price is half the price as compared to getting it from the vet. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Gee

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I used this to rear a couple of baby bunnieis and they grew up to be quite healthy. I currently buy it regularly for hand raising kittens that I foster for our local animal shelter. Amazon has the best price I have been able to find on the internet and I cannot beat the prime shipping. I just mix up an entire days worth in my vitamix on it's lowest speed setting which helps prevent bubbles and eliminates lumps. For some reason this formula doesn't mix as well as the puppy version but it sure beats the cost of the premade cans of milk. They also have a frequent buyer program if you go to the PetAg web site.
customer_reviews.author: Mom2Roscoe

customer_reviews.title: Consistent quality
customer_reviews.text: Have 2 four month old cats since they were 2 weeks old. They've gotten into habit of having some milk before bed, and it's how I get them into their room at night. Ran out once, anarchy reigned. Took 45 minutes to get them to bed, no kidding. Will never run out again, lol. Dog has a bit before bed too. No stomach upsets with any of them.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Bolo

customer_reviews.title: For cats
customer_reviews.text: I keep this on hand for the stray kitties I feed. No kittens as intended for that use, but I mix it into the canned food and add a bit of water for the stray cats I feed...it's an extra layer of flavor and some extra nutrients.
customer_reviews.author: ms r.

customer_reviews.title: Good for kittens AND for nursing queens
customer_reviews.text: We have cared for multiple litters as foster kittens and have used other brands of kitten formula. KMR is the only one that is readily accepted by all the kittens, especially when it is time to start weaning them and teaching them to lap from a bowl. We have also given milk replacer to nursing queens for extra calories and fat, and of all the brands I've tried (Hartz, Petlac, GNR), Kitten Milk Replacer is the only one that the mother cat accepted readily and seemed to enjoy the taste of. It is a little more expensive than other brands (although not by much) but worth the extra cost.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Well tolerated mother’s milk replacement for kittens
customer_reviews.text: I rescued 2 orphaned kittens who didn’t know how to eat soft food. Both tolerated the milk well. They loved the flavor. One was very small & at risk but thrived & is robust & energetic. Good quality mothers milk replacement.
customer_reviews.author: JMVJMV

customer_reviews.title: Kitten Milk Replacer
customer_reviews.text: KMR must have in your cattery. Its a go to product for babies having difficulty nursing or ones that need supplement. Canister seals good. Mix with Water. Also should purchase Colostrum if trying to rescue or keep kittens alive if mother unable to nurse. Warm to tepid heat (like 10 to 15 seconds in Micro-Wave) check to make sure its not too hot by placing small drop on to your wrist. Dispose of portion not used once mixed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product at an amazing price what more could you ask for?!
customer_reviews.text: This is the real deal at half the of the store price ! A fabulous treat that causes no digestive upset, keeps for a very long time in the freezer! Great product, fast shipping, great price!
customer_reviews.author: DLuvsTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: KMR Milk for kittens
customer_reviews.text: My kitten and 3 year old love this milk. It gets 5 stars on that account. But I give it a 1 star review on price, especially the 24 ounce can which is nearly 3 times as much as the 12 ounce. SMH! I will never understand why people feel the need to price gouge food items whether they be for humans or animals. Fortunately, I won't have to buy this much longer.
customer_reviews.author: Anjolie Saydworthe

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this product for any kitten. We took in a kitten that was abandoned by it's mother and we fed him KMR. We originally had him on another formula but he had digestive issues with it. The vet recommend we change him to this formula. His issues quickly cleared up. Easy to mix and he loved it. He's now a year old and thriving.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine Carroll

customer_reviews.title: I have been very happy with the KMR formula and my kitties eagerly drink ...
customer_reviews.text: We are using to use this powder to make milk to feed two orphaned kittens. I have been very happy with the KMR formula and my kitties eagerly drink it at each feeding.
customer_reviews.author: K. M. Nuttall

customer_reviews.title: Lumpy
customer_reviews.text: This product worked OK, but would settle out on the bottom of the container after mixing. Even when heated and using a whisk, there would still be chunks on the bottom. Switched to another brand and did not have this problem.
customer_reviews.author: One of the Seven Ks

customer_reviews.title: Great price and quality
customer_reviews.text: My kitten has been eating this since 3 weeks old. Mom unfortunately died do we had to start formula. We bought this same brand for half the size (6oz) at our local pet store for 17.99. Obviously when I found out I could get double the amount for less money I was all over it. This is my 2nd can I’ve ordered from this seller and I’m impressed. Don’t worry it doesn’t expire for an entire year.
customer_reviews.author: bobo

customer_reviews.title: Expensive milk substitute...but it works well
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a stray mommy cat who was so weak she couldn't walk straight. Yet she was still dutifully nursing her second litter of 4. The kittens also lapped this up so mommy cat didn't have to expend extra calories that she desperately needed. Mommy cat regained her strength after a few days of this and lots of canned food. She is now spayed and appears happy and energetic. I am now stuck with her and her 6 off-springs from her 2 litters.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff, we had great results vs others brands
customer_reviews.text: This stuff dissolves really easily/readily. It's helped our kitten grow healthy!- in other words this stuff worked for us! Observations were constant on her health. our poor lil female maine coon kitten was looking weak,def pulled too early from momma. Immediately she took a liking to this formula. Almost like crack. But she began eating the dry nuggets and wet food as hoped shortly after. both physical energy and body growth levels exceeded expectations and now we have a cr a y lil kitten growing up and living life under our care instead of out there in the weeds, fleas, and wild trees.
customer_reviews.author: KeanuReid

customer_reviews.title: Clumpy and grainy texture
customer_reviews.text: KMR is the most popular formula to use for kittens but I don't understand why. I previously exclusively used Petlac made by the same brand for my fosters and never had issues with it. Maybe I got a bad batch but the KMR I received was so CLUMPY. No matter what I tried it seemed to always clump and it was grainy. It also constipated my fosters. Never again. I hate returning things but this was sent back to amazon and exchanged for Petlac. Petlac is also cheaper so I would go with that instead.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Cortez

customer_reviews.title: My 16yo cat LOVES this and it helped his fur grow back!
customer_reviews.text: Poor baby was very sick and after a full-body shave his fur would not grow back for 7 months. He was all patchy. Within 2 weeks of taking 2 scoops a day his fur started to grow back and he put a little weight on. He then had his surgery and kept on this stuff as a side dish and his Persian coat is beautiful again now :)
customer_reviews.author: The Ashley Colette

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great product
customer_reviews.text: I had been given a kitten around 6 weeks old, having many cats in my life i knew i received her too young. I did not want her to lose any necessary nutrition so I bought KMR. I originally bought i from petco (in a can) and it was $10 for it! This powder is a much better price and my kitten doesn’t know the difference. She loves the taste!
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy any other brand!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to help my mama kitty feed her 5 kittens. Kittens and mama love it. To save time, bought a can of PetAg at Walmart when my KMR ran out. Not one of the 6 will touch it. Who knew all milk replacements weren't the same! I just came back to buy the large can. I'll mix it with the other if they will let me. The mama used to be a stray and is in poor health. Kittens are now 5 weeks old. She gets spayed in three weeks so she can stay here and be a pet. I'll keep using this to get the poor girl in shape.
customer_reviews.author: Cloud shadow

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay
customer_reviews.text: This seemed to separate with the water fairly quickly and did not look to be of the best stuff. Our kitten still drank it and for the value it deserves 4 stars, but finding something else is what we ended up doing.
customer_reviews.author: cPratt

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use kittens enjoy it
customer_reviews.text: Best milk replacement product I’ve found and the kittens really enjoy it. Will have it on hand always Incase it’s needed. Lost all my possessions in a house fire will be replaced in the future very easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Luanne

customer_reviews.title: brande highly recommended, shipped okay
customer_reviews.text: this is what my local shelter uses for its kittens who need it. i bought it in case my cat gets ill, hopefully not, want to donate it later in. its a bit high priced, but not too bad. was shipped on time, no problems. this brande is highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Good price
customer_reviews.text: After two kittens lost their mama I was able to feed the babies with an eye dropper and later by bottle. The kittens are flourishing and are now 6 months old. It's not an easy task but the kittens liked the taste and I liked the nutrition value of the product
customer_reviews.author: Snickles

customer_reviews.title: Have an old thin cat with bad teeth, this really helps fatter her up and give her the calories and vitamins she needed.
customer_reviews.text: Have an old thin cat with bad teeth, this really helps fatter her up and give her the calories and vitamins she needed. She is going in for surgery soon, and wanted to make sure she was healthy and ready for it and it really perks her up. I noticed a big difference. Not chunky or lumpy at all, just have to use hot tap water and I used a shrimp fork to whip it up in a little saucer and she was good to go and loves it. It's 1:2 ratio, so add the water a little slowly and make it like gravy.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Not A Happy customer!
customer_reviews.text: This is how my Product arrived... The canister was smashed the formula all inside the envelope! This should have been shipped in a box not an envelope😡 I rescue kittens !!! I needed this! Not Happy
customer_reviews.author: Debb P Brown

customer_reviews.title: NECESSARY FOR KITTENS & HELPED REPLENISH MAMA CAT TOO!
customer_reviews.text: My kittens love this formula! Tasted it myself & It actually tastes like Baby Formula..the mama cat actually got a little mad because the babies we're not begging for milk anymore .Her nipples needed a break. I also fed her with it as well,to replenish her & get some vitamins back in her system. Thank you KMR!
customer_reviews.author: Mz.Bozz

customer_reviews.title: Kmr Saves Lives
customer_reviews.text: Many of the highly regarded rescues swear by Kmr kitten formula. Because of this formula some severely malnourished and cold dying kittens were able to make it to weaning and prepare for adoption. It's a great formula for babies.
customer_reviews.author: Missy K.

product_meta.title: KMR - Kitten Milk Replacer
product_meta.description: Size:12 Oz| Style:PowderAll natural, no preservatives, made in the USA. A complete food source for orphaned or rejected kittens or those nursing, but needing supplemental feeding. Also recommended for growing kittens or adult cats that are stressed and require a source of highly digestible nutrients. KMR is a complete diet for kittens fortified with vitamins and minerals. KMR's life saving formula closely matches queen's milk in protein and energy and also contains taurine. Powder formula is easy to mix with water.
feature_bullets: Formulated to provide a caloric pattern similar to queen's milk in protein, fat, and carbohydrates.
Supplies necessary vitamins and minerals to ensure proper development and growth.
Ideal supplement for post-surgery and convalescence.
Easy to digest, highly palatable, easy to mix formula.
For kittens newborn to six weeks of age.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
